data.title: Fitbit Is Tracking Closer to Its Deal With Google
data.text: European regulators are considering new concessions that should allow Alphabet to close its deal and pay $7.35 per share for FIT stock. The post Fitbit Is Tracking Closer to Its Deal With Google appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Liz Ann Sonders on FAANG stocks: There is antitrust risk regardless of election results
data.text: Liz Ann Sonders, Charles Schwab chief investment strategist, joins 'Closing Bell' to talk about how she's telling investors to be mindful of pairing big tech stocks as the crackdown on antitrust continues.

data.title: Step Up Or Break Up: The Challenge For Big Tech
data.text: Evidence suggests the Big Five maintain their dominance thanks to insufficient regulation, anticompetitive behavior & business models that manipulate users. The risks they pose to civic society are immense however they can still become stewards of the societies that have powered their success.

data.title: Backers of Australia's mandatory news code welcome French ruling on Google
data.text: Paris court orders the tech giant to discuss compensation with publishers for using content in search results or on Google News

data.title: Factbox: Big Tech's market dominance spurs numerous U.S. antitrust probes
data.text: The four Big Tech companies -- Alphabet's Google , Amazon , Apple and Facebook -- face an array of antitrust investigations at the federal and state level which were revealed in mid-2019.

data.title: Journalism, Beware Of Google’s Billion-Dollar Siren Calls!
data.text: “What could possibly make a company want to give away 0.15 percent of its revenue? The threat of someone else taking 10 percent of it.

data.title: Google's new streaming TV gadget is a great alternative to Roku or Amazon Fire TV
data.text: It's Google's first real rival to the Roku and Amazon Fire TV and comes with a remote and really good Google TV software.

data.title: Insider CEO Henry Blodget on how Microsoft's antitrust history compares to today
data.text: Big Tech regulation is back in focus this week after a House committee called some big names monopolies. Henry Blodget, CEO and co-founder of Insider, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss.

data.title: Self-Driving Perks Up With Alphabet's Move: What are Others Doing?
data.text: Alphabet (GOOGL) re-launches robo-taxi ride-hailing service, which intensifies competition in the autonomous vehicle space.

data.title: 9 Gaming Stocks That Won’t Hit ‘Game Over’ Anytime Soon

data.title: Should Tech Investors Worry About Antitrust?
data.text: Investors should take a deep breath before panic-selling.
